header.name: chaos/preprocessor/facilities/encode.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines macros used to encode and decode arguments containing commas.

macro.abstract: The macro encodes its arguments by wrapping them in parentheses.
macro.para: This macro is used as a complement to to pass an argument that is logically a single argument but is physically more than one argument.
This macro is used to decode arguments possibly encoded with .
If __VA_ARGS__ is a parenthetic expression, this macro expands to the contents of that parenthetic expression. Otherwise, it expands to __VA_ARGS__.
The common use case for this macro is currently theoretical, as C++ does not yet allow variadic arguments.
macro.listing:
#include #include
#if
#define MACRO(type) (type)
MACRO(int) // int MACRO((std::pair<int, int>)) // std::pair<int, int>
#endif
